intro: Cryptandra pungens, commonly known as the spiked cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and often have a glandular appearance, contributing to its distinctive botanical profile. Cryptandra pungens is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought and heat.
